image.altText: A digital rendering the entrance to a stdium.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's parliamentarians have received a draft version of the order they'll vote on to determine the fate of the Macquarie Point Stadium project.

title.children: A draft order to approve Hobart’s stadium has been released. What’s in it?

image.altText: A large white and yellow ship with cranes and lifeboats on the side.

props.synopsis: Two years after the RSV Nuyina was banned from going under Hobart's Tasman Bridge to refuel, the Australian Antarctic Division has formally ditched the possibility of trying to overturn the decision.

title.children: Icebreaker's costly bridge ban won't be reassessed

image.altText: a professional woman smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The former clinical director of the Hobart Clinic, psychiatrist Dr Hannah Lake, is part of a last-minute push for the institution to be given a reprieve before it closes its doors at the end of next week.

title.children: Leading doctor's 11th-hour bid for $2m rescue of Hobart Clinic

image.altText: Hobart Lord Mayor Sue Hickey in ceremonial chains and robe.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian councillors could be removed from their democratically elected positions under changes proposed to local government legislation.

title.children: Tasmanian government moves to crack down on unruly councillors

image.altText: A big industrial building

props.synopsis: Aurora Energy is seeking a $7 million bank guarantee to cover energy costs for the Boyer Mill in southern Tasmania, but the paper mill's owner says the request is "obscene".

title.children: Owner says 'obscene' demand from energy retailer threatens Australia's last paper mill

image.altText: Kerry Forrest standing on the street.

props.synopsis: In the three years that Kerry Forrest has been applying for positions on Tasmania's north-west coast, she has faced repeated rejection. She thinks it is time employers consider older workers more favourably.

title.children: 'I'm 65 that's what's different': Kerry has never had trouble finding work, until now

image.altText: A baby in a white top with cartoon animals on it lies on a rug on the floor with her fist against her mouth.

props.synopsis: The death of a 15-week-old baby in an unlicensed home day care in Victoria’s north-west is among more than two dozen disturbing childcare incidents recorded in government documents unearthed by the ABC.

title.children: Infant's death in illegal child care kept hidden from public

image.altText: A man in a grey suit holds his arms out in front of him.

props.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Ted O'Brien was ejected from Question Time for interjecting as Jim Chalmers joked his counterpart's question wasn't "based on reality". Follow live.

title.children: Shadow treasurer ejected from chamber as renewables, women returning from Syria dominate QT

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: O'Brien ejected from QT after Chalmers says his question was 'not based on reality'
Prime minister welcomes news of peace deal in the Middle East
DEWR secretary 'struck by the lack of apology' from Deloitte after it used AI to generate report

image.altText: A close up head-on shot of an Aboriginal woman in yellow and blue striped guernsey, serious expression, brown hair tied back.

props.synopsis: A fatal hit-and-run case in Darwin has exposed deep disparities in the NT’s justice system, say Aboriginal leaders, as the victim’s family speaks out.

title.children: 'There's no justice': Outrage as Jake Danby walks after fatal hit-and-run

image.altText: Man lying face down on the road, handcuffed behind his back next to a car with the door open. He's surrounded by police and cars

props.synopsis: It is a tried and true tactic in the underworld when trying to get away with murder, but police have sought out "kill cars" and they are reaping the rewards from it.

title.children: Police turn attention to use of 'kill cars' in attempted underworld hits

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: The S&P and Nasdaq have closed at new highs and Australian stocks are following the upwards trajectory. Federal Reserve officials are split on the outlook for US interest rates, the latest meeting minutes show. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX rises as Wall Street notches fresh records

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Aussie retail investors buy the dip in healthcare stocks in Q3: analyst
ASX  up with materials sector best performing
Elders to finalise Delta Agribusiness merger subject to divestments

image.altText: An aerial shot of white roofed houses.

props.synopsis: Domain's September quarterly report shows house rents across the country's combined capitals have remained stable for five consecutive quarters.

title.children: Two Australian cities buck national rental trend

image.altText: A shot from behind shows a man sitting at a desk looking at a computer screen.

props.synopsis: An Australian university has accused thousands of its students of cheating with artificial intelligence. The problem? Many have done nothing wrong.

title.children: University caught out using AI to wrongly accuse students of cheating with AI

image.altText: Women and men protesting for Palestine outside the New South Wales Supreme Court holding signs and the Palestinian flag.

props.synopsis: The Palestine Action Group had expected 40,000 people to attend the rally on Sunday.

title.children: NSW court rules in police's favour over planned Sydney Opera House march

image.altText: A woman wearing black standing in the doorway opening of a tent.

props.synopsis: The war in Gaza may be ending soon, but those displaced by Israel's bombardment and invasion know their suffering is far from over.

title.children: After eight moves, Majeda is exhausted. This is her story of displacement in Gaza

image.altText: Jamarra Ugle-Hagan with the ball against the Demons in 2024.

props.synopsis: Gold Coast is in the thick of the action so far on day four of the trade period as fallen star Jamarra Ugle-Hagan prepares to do a medical with the club. Follow live.

title.children: Jamarra speaks on Suns move as Saints secure electric forward

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: MOVEMENT! Eagles and Saints reach agreement on Liam Ryan
Jamarra Ugle-Hagan speaks on potential Suns signing
St Kilda has abandoned its pursuit of Leek Aleer

image.altText: Kate McCann and Gerry McCann sitting together talking

props.synopsis: The mother of Madeleine McCann says a woman accused of stalking her for over two years made her feel distressed and "invaded" by approaching her at her house and claiming to be her daughter. Madeleine went missing in 2007, aged three.

title.children: Mother of missing Maddie McCann tells court of fear of alleged stalker

image.altText: Dolly Parton, wearing rhinestone dress on a stage, raises her hands.

props.synopsis: Dolly Parton has taken to social media to hose down speculation about her health after a comment from her sister sent fans into a tailspin.

title.children: 'Do I look sick to you?' Dolly Parton reassures fans after scare

image.altText: do not use Anika Wells

props.synopsis: The government is determined to avoid wearing any blame for Optus' failure but also needs to be transparent about how it handled early advice from the telco.

title.children: Bureaucrat grilling over Optus led to more questions than answers

image.altText: A closeup of a man with grey hair and glasses, wearing a suit, walking near the court.

props.synopsis: Former ACT attorney-general Gordon Ramsay has faced the ACT Magistrates Court, charged with grooming a teenage boy.

title.children: Former ACT politician charged with grooming teen

image.altText: A digital rendering the entrance to a stdium.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's parliamentarians have received a draft version of the order they'll vote on to determine the fate of the Macquarie Point Stadium project.

title.children: A draft order to approve Hobart's stadium has been released. What's in it?

image.altText: Two mining stacks in the distance.

props.synopsis: Mining giant Glencore's government bailout was touted as its outback smelter's saving grace, but uncertainty about a fertiliser plant it relies on could still see it cease production before 2028.

title.children: Despite $600m taxpayer bailout, Mount Isa's copper production not secure

image.altText: artie mintzas 2

props.synopsis: A close family member of Artemios Mintzas tells the ABC she asked police to visit his unit three weeks ago, after growing increasingly concerned about his state of mind.

title.children: 'We tried to help him': Family of alleged Sydney gunman speak out

image.altText: A shark opens it's mouth as a screaming man falls into it.

props.synopsis: Mystery Road star Mark Coles Smith and his Beast of War director Kiah Roache-Turner on taking a chomp out of WWII soldiers.

title.children: Beast of War tells the true story of WWII soldiers stalked by a hungry shark

image.altText: Two armed men in military fatigues stand in front of a chain-link fence topped with barbed wire.

props.synopsis: An Argentine Football Association executive confirms an upcoming football match against Puerto Rico is moving from Chicago due to the National Guard being called in to quell immigration protests.

title.children: International football friendly moved amid immigration protests

image.altText: THUMB: Map project energyconnect

props.synopsis: Touted as a model for the energy transition, a "quick and easy" high-voltage powerline project linking South Australia directly to New South Wales is running dramatically over time and over budget.

title.children: 'Extension cord to nowhere' looms large as Australia’s energy transition evolves

image.altText: Murray Watt presser

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt will sit down with his Liberal counterpart Angie Bell today, with quiet optimism in both parties that a deal might soon be struck to finally rewrite Australia's "broken" and outdated environment laws.

title.children: Watt nears deal with Coalition to finally overhaul environment laws

image.altText: coutts crossing bushfire

props.synopsis: A volunteer firefighter is hospitalised with head and neck injuries after being hit by a falling tree on a fireground on the NSW north coast.

title.children: Firefighter suffers serious injuries after being hit by falling tree

image.altText: Woman outside home looking at camera

props.synopsis: A Queensland woman is on a mission to raise awareness about hereditary fructose intolerance, after having to wait until age 45 to understand why so many foods make her sick.

title.children: The challenging rare condition that makes most fruit and veg off limits

image.altText: Kerry Forrest standing on the street.

props.synopsis: In the three years that 65-year-old Kerry Forrest has been applying for positions, she has faced repeated rejection. She thinks it is time employers consider older workers more favourably.

title.children: 'I'm 65. That's what's different': Kerry has never had trouble finding work — until now

image.altText: A green long narco sub

props.synopsis: Cousins Reubenson and Martin Fugui found a 'Made in Colombia' narco sub in Solomon Islands over the weekend — the third such vessel found in the country's waters over the past year.

title.children: 'Made in Colombia' narco sub found floating in Solomon Islands

image.altText: A medium shot of a woman standing next to a box of tiny art pieces

props.synopsis: A new tiny art gallery on WA's south coast adds to a growing global movement of community verge-side offerings that range from puzzles to seed exchange.

title.children: Gallery of tiny treasures joins global community
